channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Stressed' elephant gores Spanish tourist to death in Thailand
item.description: Blanca Ojanguren García was gored to death while bathing the animal.

item.title: Biden bans offshore drilling across vast area of US
item.description: President Biden has announced a ban on offshore oil and gas drilling along most of America's coastline.

item.title: Biden bans new offshore oil and gas drilling in most federal waters

item.title: Justin Trudeau may quit within days, say Canadian media
item.description: The pressure has been building for months, with sinking poll numbers for the prime minister's ruling Liberal Party.

item.title: Is this Bitcoin's golden moment? These are 3 key things to watch for cryptos in 2025

item.title: Major US winter blast shuts down schools and government offices in several states
Man behind New Year’s attack visited New Orleans before, recorded video with smart glasses, FBI says
item.description: He also recorded video of the French Quarter with hands-free glasses, the FBI says.

item.title: Israeli officials say 3 killed in attack on vehicles in occupied West Bank
item.description: Far-right Israeli official calls for destruction of Palestinian town in occupied West Bank after 3 killed, 7 wounded in shooting attack.

item.title: Hamas lists 34 hostages it may free under ceasefire
item.description: The list is released as new Israeli air strikes kill dozens in Gaza over the weekend.

item.title: Mozambique opposition leader says he will return home from exile
item.description: Venâncio Mondlane left Mozambique shortly before last October's elections, which he says he won.

item.title: Gunmen open fire on bar customers, killing 5 and wounding 7
item.description: Gunmen burst into the bar La Casita Azul and opened fire at customers, leaving bloodied bodies strewn on the floor according to local media.

item.title: Snowstorms close schools and offices across a large swath of the U.S.
item.description: Several governors have issued states of emergency as 6 to 12 inches of snow are expected from Ohio to Washington, D.C.
